alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:29PM MST until August 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, northwest Cochise and southwest Graham. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ash Creek, Bollen Wash, South Oak Creek, Tres Alamos Wash, Sheep Camp Wash, North Oak Creek, Sycamore Creek, Oak Creek, Paddys River, High Creek, Aravaipa Creek, Rattlesnake Creek, San Pedro River, Redfield Canyon, South Fork Ash Creek, Horton Creek, Hot Springs Canyon, Gardner Creek, Walnut Wash and Soza Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cochise and Muleshoe Ranch Preserve. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
